content.description: Nice mixed route on N side. Start up crystal band clipping 4 bolts then place gear in disappearing crack as it hooks left. Make a thin slab traverse left to the exposed arete getting 3 more bolts to the top. Comfy belay from bolted anchor just below summit.
content.protection: 7 bolts   Single rack green C3-#3 & Nuts   Chain anchors
content.location: Should be easy to spot bolt line from N side gully. 60m rope gets you down.

content.description: Climb the fun crack past good rails to get to the first bolt. The bolts protect the business. A very well protected route with multiple cruxes, but also some good rests.
content.protection: Nuts   single fingers-hands, small rack   5 bolts    2 bolt/webbing summit anchor
content.location: South face   Start at the crack

content.description: Smaller formation about 100' tall. I believe only has 2 routes currently. A steep south facing yellow wall.
